notesStmt.note: Folios 251v, 252r&v contain attempts by someone learning to write Hebrew.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Special portions for Rosh ḥodesh, Purim, Ḥanukah

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each, marked with catchwords and signed with Hebrew letters at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Small Italian square and semi-cursive scripts of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Boxed. Spine: 'Machzor. Sec. Ritum Synagog. Romanae. Abbievatum. Hebrew. Mus. Brit. Jure Emptionis. 18,230.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Adolphus Asher (b. 1800, d. 1853), Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): purchased from him on 13 July 1850: inscribed, [257v].
